hanzi-su-wiki:
裏

Значения

Изнанка, оборотная сторона; внутренний

Мнемоника

Одежда 衣 деревенских 里 крестьян, которую для экономии носят то лицевой, то изнаночной стороной наружу.

Варианты

里, 裡

  • the inside of clothes 衣 resembles the patched clothes of the people in a village 里

  • place 里 inside clothes 衣

    • 里 [ lǐ ] unit of distance equal to 0.5km; village; lane
heisig_story: An innocent looking top hat and scarf lying there in front of you, turned over, reveal a hidden computer sewn into the back of each - obviously the tools of a master spy. Such experiences teach one always to have a look at the back side of things.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: back, amidst, in, reverse, inside, palm, sole, rear, lining, wrong side
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: назад, среди, в, наоборот, внутрь, ладони, подошвы, задний, подкладка, изнанка
koohiiStory1: The computer had carefully dressed up in clothes to look human. It was n´t until I looked at the back and saw the cables and stuff that I realized what it was.
koohiiStory2: Can computers be gay? I´m not sure, but mine always wears a top hat and scarf, and for some reason its back door port is always open...
jp_example_words:
裏返し(うらがえし): inside out, upside down
裏返す(うらがえす): turn inside out, turn the other way, turn over
裏切る(うらぎる): betray, double-cross
裏口(うらぐち): back door, rear entrance
裏(うら): the back, the wrong side
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There's a lid on your village, so you kick it over on its backside to see what's on its underside.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You've been curious about what's on the lid (and your village's) backside for years, and you finally can't take it anymore so you kick the lid as hard as you can!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: It turns out your village's own backside is covered in uranium (うら). Eureka! You're all gonna be rich!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Wait, isn't uranium bad for people? This explains why all of the villagers backsides are covered in weird glowing, green lumps.
Ru_Meaning: back, amidst, in, reverse, inside, palm, sole, rear, lining, wrong side
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the clothes (𧘇) in the village (里) under the lid (亠) are at the back side
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " clothes ", " in " sound. Same as Xiaozhuan. The original meaning is the inner layer of clothes. The variant is called " li ". "poetry. Bei Feng. "Green Clothes": "Green clothes, green clothes and yellow linings." "Book of Rites-Yuzao": "The emperor has Zhu Li". "Shu Wen": "Lin, also in the clothes. Sound from the clothes." Both refer to the "lizi" in the clothes, and "Zhou Li‧ Xia Guan Sima‧ Bianshi": "Xuanmian Zhuli", referring to Although it is a crown rather than a shirt, the meaning is similar. Today, Cantonese still refer to the inner layer of cloth as "shirt li" (lei5); they also describe people who are stylishly dressed as "suit jacket" (lei5).

The word " li " was later universally extended to " li " (leoi5) for inside and outside, and its meaning became much broader. Duan Yucai's note: "Extension is the envelopment of everything inside." As seen in the inscriptions, both are extended meanings, referring to the inner layer of the car power. Yu Bogui: "Hu Xian (Power) Zhu Li". It means that the car power is made of tiger skin, and its inner layer is vermilion. Guo Moruo said: "All words must have their insides. The color of the insides may be either vermilion or smoked or secluded. It can be seen that the insides are things, and the insides are also places to look at." Also "Zhou Li‧ Xia Guan Sima‧ Bian Shi ": "Xuanmian Zhuli" has a similar meaning.

In Hong Kong, the word "里" was originally used far more popular than the word "里". Since the development of Chinese computers, due to the use of the "Big5" standard in Hong Kong, the word "里" is not used in many font systems. Being supported, it was gradually replaced by the word "里". But this problem is actually not serious, because "里" and "里" are both traditional characters. The former is written in ancient times and can be traced back to inscriptions, and the latter is the beginning character, but both of them start from "衣" from "里". , Are all pictophonetic structures, which are variants, so there is no doubt. Because "li/li" is a different body, it is the same as "group/group" or "稾/draft".
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " clothes ", " in " sound. Same as Xiaozhuan. The original meaning is the inner layer of clothes. The variant is called " li ".
humanum_full_description:
金文從「衣」，「里」聲。與小篆同。本義是衣服的內層。異體作「裡」。《詩．邶風．綠衣》：「綠兮衣兮，綠衣黃裏。」《禮記‧玉藻》：「天子素帶朱裏」。《說文》：「裏，衣内也。从衣里聲。」皆指衣服向內的「裏子」，又《周禮‧夏官司馬‧弁師》：「玄冕朱裏」，指的雖是冠冕而非衣衫，其意亦相類似。今粵人仍把衣服朝內的一層布料稱作「衫裏」(lei5)；又會把穿著入時和光鮮整齊的人形容為「西裝夾裏」(lei5)。

　　「裏」字後來普遍地引申為裏外的「裏」(leoi5)，意義便寛闊得多了。段玉裁注：「引伸為凡在內之偁。」如金文所見皆為引申義，指車冪之內層。彔伯簋：「虎冟(冪)朱裏」。表示用虎皮做的車冪，其內層是朱紅色的。郭沫若曰：「凡言冟必及其裏，裏之色或朱或熏或幽，可見冟之為物，其裏亦在當重觀瞻之處。」又《周禮‧夏官司馬‧弁師》：「玄冕朱裏」，其意亦相類似。

　　又「裏」字於香港，本來用得遠較「裡」字為普及，自中文電腦發達以來，由於香港用「大五碼」(Big5)標準，「裏」字於許多字型制式中不被支援，遂漸被「裡」字取代。但這問題其實並不嚴重，因「裏」、「裡」都是繁體字，前者為古代寫法，可追溯至金文，後者為後起字，但二者都从「衣」从「里」，皆為形聲結構，其之為異體字，斷無疑問。因「裏/裡」為異體，與「羣/群」或「稾/稿」之為異體道理一樣。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「衣」，「里」聲。與小篆同。本義是衣服的內層。異體作「裡」。

金文從「 衣 」，「 里 」聲。與小篆同。本義是衣服的內層。異體作「 裡 」。《詩．邶風．綠衣》：「綠兮衣兮，綠衣黃裏。」《禮記‧玉藻》：「天子素帶朱裏」。《說文》：「裏，衣内也。从衣里聲。」皆指衣服向內的「裏子」，又《周禮‧夏官司馬‧弁師》：「玄冕朱裏」，指的雖是冠冕而非衣衫，其意亦相類似。今粵人仍把衣服朝內的一層布料稱作「衫裏」(lei5)；又會把穿著入時和光鮮整齊的人形容為「西裝夾裏」(lei5)。 「 裏 」字後來普遍地引申為裏外的「 裏 」(leoi5)，意義便寛闊得多了。段玉裁注：「引伸為凡在內之偁。」如金文所見皆為引申義，指車冪之內層。彔伯簋：「虎冟(冪)朱裏」。表示用虎皮做的車冪，其內層是朱紅色的。郭沫若曰：「凡言冟必及其裏，裏之色或朱或熏或幽，可見冟之為物，其裏亦在當重觀瞻之處。」又《周禮‧夏官司馬‧弁師》：「玄冕朱裏」，其意亦相類似。 又「 裏 」字於香港，本來用得遠較「 裡 」字為普及，自中文電腦發達以來，由於香港用「大五碼」(Big5)標準，「 裏 」字於許多字型制式中不被支援，遂漸被「 裡 」字取代。但這問題其實並不嚴重，因「 裏 」、「 裡 」都是繁體字，前者為古代寫法，可追溯至金文，後者為後起字，但二者都从「 衣 」从「 里 」，皆為形聲結構，其之為異體字，斷無疑問。因「裏/裡」為異體，與「羣/群」或「稾/稿」之為異體道理一樣。

裏字的基本解释

裏
lǐ
见“里”④⑤。

裏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǐ］
［《廣韻》良士切，上止，來。］
亦作“裡1”。
(1)衣服的内层。
(2)指器具的内层。
(3)里面，内部。与“外”相对。表示方位。
(4)专指家或家乡。
(5)里面，内部。与“外”相对。附着在“这、那、哪”等字后边，表示处所。
(6)里面，内部。与“外”相对。表示范围。
(7)里面，内部。与“外”相对。表时间。
(8)中医指腹胁之内。
(9)指胞胎。《诗·小雅·小弁》：“不屬于毛，不罹于裏。”毛传：“毛在外陽以言父，裏在内陰以言母。”郑玄笺：“今我獨不得父皮膚之氣乎？獨不處母之胞胎乎？”一说通“理”，指腠理。
(10)助词。用在句末，相当于“哩”、“呢”。
(11)助词。用在句中。相当于“得”、“的”、“底”。
(12)通“理”。治理，整理。

裏字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　裏； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1117第04
【唐韻】良士切【集韻】【韻會】兩耳切，?音里。【說文】衣內也。【詩·邶風】綠衣黃裏。又【小雅】不屬于毛，不離于裏。　又治裏，謂道氣也。【班固·幽通賦】單治裏而外凋兮。　又【類篇】良志切，音吏。義同。【干祿字書】俗作裏。裏字作重下?。

裏字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
裏字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
in
lǐ
See "里"④⑤.
in
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lǐ］
["Guangyun" Liangshi cut, top stop, come. ]
Also known as "Lin 1".
(1) The inner layer of clothes.
(2) Refers to the inner layer of the appliance.
(3) Inside, inside. Contrast with "outside". Indicates the position.
(4) It refers specifically to home or hometown.
(5) Inside, inside. Contrast with "outside". Attached to the words "this, that, what" and other words indicate the location.
(6) Inside, inside. Contrast with "outside". Indicates the scope.
(7) Inside, inside. Contrast with "outside". Table time.
(8) Chinese medicine refers to the inside of the abdomen and flank.
(9) Refers to the fetus. "Poetry·Xiaoya·Xiaobian": "Does not belong to Mao and does not suffer from the inside." Mao Chuan: "Mao is in the outer yang to speak for his father, while inside the inner yin for his mother." Zheng Xuanjian: "Today I am not a father alone. Is the skin irritating? Not being alone with the mother's womb?" When it comes to "reason", it refers to the principle.
(10) Particles. Used at the end of a sentence, it is equivalent to "mile" and "ne".
(11) Particles. Used in sentences. Equivalent to "得", "的", "Bottom".
(12) Through "reason". Govern, organize.
in
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Jixia] [Yi Zi Department] 　 Li; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1117 04
[Tang Yun] Liang Shi cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] cut in both ears, in the sound. [Said the text] The clothes are also inside. 【Poetry·Bei Feng】Green clothes and yellow lining. Also 【Xiaoya】Does not belong to Mao, not to leave.　You Zhili is also called Dao Qi. 【Banggu·Youtongfu】Single treatment withered from inside out.　[Classes] Liang Zhi cut, voice officer. The same meaning. 【The Book of Qianlu Characters】In the popular writing. Make the words repetitive?.

вм. 里
Radicals: 亠, 里  (lid, village, kick)
Meaning Mnemonic
There's a lid on your village, so you kick it over on its backside to see what's on its underside.
You've been curious about what's on the lid (and your village's) backside for years, and you finally can't take it anymore so you kick the lid as hard as you can!
Reading Mnemonic
It turns out your village's own backside is covered in uranium (うら). Eureka! You're all gonna be rich!
Wait, isn't uranium bad for people? This explains why all of the villagers backsides are covered in weird glowing, green lumps.
